abstract.p: Thales, French military company, says revenue totaled 8.6 billion euros in 2000, up 25 percent from year earlier; net income declined 27 percent, to 201 million euros (S)

block.p: Thales, the French military electronics company, said revenue in 2000 benefited from acquisitions, although one-time charges related to those purchases caused a decline in net income for the year. The acquisitions of Racal Electronics of Britain, ADI of Australia and Thales Samsung of South Korea contributed 1 billion euros ($915 million) to revenue, which totaled 8.6 billion euros, up 25 percent from the year earlier. Net income declined 27 percent, to 201 million euros.
